headline.main: Letter from Senator Houston, in reply to an Invitation to Visit New-York.

docs.lead_paragraph: MY DEAR SIR: I thank you for your kind favor, but find it out of my power to comply with your request and that of other friends. In a few days I hope to be on my way to see my family. Recently I learn that Mrs. HOUSTON'S health is quite feeble. Every hour of my time, until I can depart, will necessarily be employed in business, to enable me to get off.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times::

headline.main: A TOUR IN THE SOUTHWEST.; NUMBER SEVEN. The German Emigration--New Braunfels.

docs.lead_paragraph: A few days after reaching San Antonio, we had occasion to return to Neu-Braunfels, and to obtain certain information were advised to call on the Superintendent of the Orphan Asylum, at New-Weit, a hamlet four miles from the town.
docs.snippet: A few days after reaching San Antonio, we had occasion to return to Neu-Braunfels, and to obtain certain information were advised to call on the Superintendent of the Orphan Asylum, at New-Weit, a hamlet four miles from the town.

docs.lead_paragraph: "The United Operative Plasterers' Trade Society of New-York" met last night at Spring-street Hall. The officers of the Society are: President, DANIEL WALFORD; Vice President, JAMES TANNER; Secretary, THOMAS HENNESY; Assistant Secretary, MICHAEL O'NEIL; Treasurer, GEORGE HARRIOTT. headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; DRAMATIC FUND ASSOCIATION. Sixth Anniversary Dinner--Interesting Speeches. UNITED STATES MARSHAL'S OFFICE.

docs.lead_paragraph: A numerous and joyous company assembled in 'he Astor House, last evening, to celebrate the Sixth Anniversary of the Dramatic Fund Association. Dinner was set out in the ladies' ordinary for over one hundred persons, the viands and wines being of a character to satisfy the guests and sustain the reputation of " mine host." docs.lead_paragraph: The City was a good deal shocked last Thursday morning, on discovering in the papers that a fatal case of yellow fever had occurred in the City, The Coroner's Jury pronounced it yellow fever ; the return to the City Inspector made it yellow fever;

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Dr. Abbott's Collection of Egyptian Antignities. New-York and Brooklyn Foreign Missionary Society. City Mortality. OPENING OF FIFTY-EIGHTH-STREET. MYSTERIOUS CONDUCTS HUMAN BONES IN CHAMBERS. THE PUGILIST SHOOTING CASE. THE PUGILIST SHOOTING CASE.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Committee appointed to receive subscriptions and take other measures for securing this valuable collection to the City, held an adjourned meeting at the Stuyvesant Institute, on Saturday evening. Dr. FRANCIS occupied the Chair.
